topic.title: Free BTC giveaway, hurry only for 1 person
topic.body:
More information inside. This is not a scam! All you need is a BTC wallet address.

I will give 10BTC to anyone who can lend me their girlfriend or wife for one night

You will have to deliver her to the White House

topic.title: How to manually sign user certs?

1566642594_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_1023_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Not really, just make sure that someone backups the domain list from time to time :)

all they have to do is show a blank page on the original domain and then everyone else that connects will have their copies of the website overwritten...

> [gitcenter](#comment_1025_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Hey @qqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqq (how many q's are there), please don't add http://127.0.0.1:43110/ prefix.

there's 17 q's in that username sir

1568744034_18oN5jkSiB1SLb4Jywb4ZnKiwXqtQ.body:
> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_116_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): How the fuck do I mute this guy?

lol

1568884440_1DwDoUmJFKbz3eaX6eXXZ2TgTiYR4.body: The last time I checked ZeroNet itself didn't work in android...

1570025997_19AdL7EWPFiXiep63Ahacx21EibX5.body:
> [randomshits](#comment_190_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): You either die for something or live for nothing.

Best post in the thread.

That being said, you guys do all know that by default ZeroNet logs every single IP address in a log file on your computer with data stamps and all that other stuff? You can switch it off but it is enabled by default and the fact that it is enabled by default means that most users are keeping a copy of your IP address with other data stamps associated to it.

1569594101_14A3LXiT8D3gtRGJSMG3eMbKDtRPd.body:
> [justcuzican](#comment_1_18bzGcGqiXjijx2DVLRw58qcaghbpF4tfp): Zeronet has so few users because when explaining to a jury how a user can take  [...]

Well I just learned something completely new here, you killed me with that picture though.

> [sijomi](#comment_4_14ZZDCbrWsetVv3dVGUjKk6f274tvvHQDx): They're is nothing that attracts average Joe to use zeronet. You need YouTube, Google, Facebook etc f to make it popular. But zeronet is not ready for such services, it won't handle page with millions of videos. Can you imagine downloading few terabytes of data to get all the way from first revision to current up to date revision of "YouTube"? That's how current zeronet works. If it's good for some geeks, not for everyday use as replacement for centralized net. [...]

A decentralized service the size of Google, YouTube, Facebook, etc, would highly depend on the reliability of the people using or promoting such a service in the first place. Decentralization is only good for a couple of things.

> [xcape2net](#comment_423_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): You're probably right.  I guess my point is to disagree with the opinion that I heard expressed that just the fact that a piece of code is open source almost by definition means that it has been gone over with a fine-tooth comb by many knowledgeable people.   What I'm saying is that even when knowledgeable people are PAID to go over a piece of code, that doesn't mean that they do a good job.  So, I imagine that when people are not being paid they are even less interested in reviewing other peoples' code.

The motivation to look through code is either to learn something from it, improve it, or steal it and make it better. I would only make an open source tool if I knew that I could make it the best tool of its kind as someone would probably look over the source code, steal it, make it better, and then sell it. If you make something unbeatable you don't have to worry about someone stealing it.

> [kusoneko](#comment_79_16PfVSZrUZuwTgs7wBt1t3ZK9rsvdskoe5): Not really, look at cryptocurrencies for example, there are alt coins that have objectively better features than bitcoins, and yet bitcoins are still the most valued and used cryptocurrency out there. Forking and improving to make your own version doesn't mean shit if most people prefer keeping the original rather than switch to your improved version.

Not really to what? Learn? Improve? Steal?
